item.title: 2025 TechRaptor Awards - Best Visual Design
item.content:encoded:
Aside from the rise of something like Ray Tracing, this category is awesome as it has expanded beyond which game can afford the best new tech to make itself look good. There's so many great looking games that do interesting visual design, and here's our best of 2025.

Here are the nominees for TechRaptor's 2025 Best Visual Design Award for outstanding, cohesive aesthetic.

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Hades II
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong
  • Ghost of Yotei

Check out here for our other award categories.

Third Place - Hollow Knight: Silksong

Developer: Team Cherry | Release Date: September 4th, 2025

Written by Andrew Otton

Hollow Knight: Silksong is a hard game. It demands precision, and mere millimeters can mean the difference between success and failure. Because of that, the visual language of the game is paramount. Thankfully, Silksong is great at showing you exactly what you need to see in an absolutely gorgeous way.

The linework is impeccable, the silhouettes of the enemies and bosses unique and varied, and the animations are crisp and clean. Every enemy is choreographed wonderfully and fits the world of bugs incredibly well.

And it's not just the technical level that Silksong excels, either. There are beautiful vistas, backgrounds, and amazingly detailed environments in every place you get to explore. It's a gorgeous game in its own right that marries its style perfectly with the technical needs of the intense platforming and combat.

Second Place - Hades II

Developer: Supergiant Games | Release Date: September 25th, 2025

Written by Andrew Otton

It feels like any time a new game from Supergiant Games releases, it will end up somewhere on that year's list of beautiful games, if not just outright winning it. That was true with the first Hades, which won not only best visual design in our 2020 awards but our overall Game of the Year as well.

Hades II just shows Supergiant Games at the top of their game. Ever since Bastion they've shown a high degree of skill in creating amazing art, animations, and a cohesive visual language that perfectly fits their games. Hades II continues that, with just an incredibly high level of polish.

Every new area full of enemies is gorgeous, full of incredible detail, and the enemies themselves fit its weird underworld aesthetic perfectly. Character portraits in dialogue are delightful, the amazing effects on-screen dazzling, and the vistas you're treated to now and then truly beautiful to look at.

Hades II is a clear sign that Supergiant has mastered their craft and approach to visual design.

Winner - Ghost of Yotei

Developer: Sucker Punch Productions | Release Date: October 2nd, 2025

Written by Austin Suther

Ghost of Yotei is the most beautiful game I’ve ever played, bar none. Before that, I might’ve said Ghost of Tsushima, but Sucker Punch Productions just one-upped itself with Yotei.

At first glance, Ghost of Yotei is a realistic rendition of the Hokkaido region of Japan. What this title does different from other high fidelity, ultra-realistic games is there’s an exaggerated beauty to Ghost of Yotei’s world. The colors are lively and the landscape is meticulously crafted so that just about every frame looks like its own painting. The leaves in the air or the ash falling from the sky create an atmosphere few games can match.

Ghost of Yotei is an exceptionally detailed game. Give the photo mode a try and zoom in on parts of the environment to see the various wildlife up close, or even get right up in the face of Atsu and see the ever-present Mount Yotei reflected in her eyes.

Be sure to stop by one of many Sumi-e Painting locations and craft your own little work of art by flicking your finger across the Duelsense touchpad. Atsu is quite an artist herself, see, and so you can see her admiration of the beautiful lands of Hokkaido in these paintings, which she proudly hangs on the wall of her dilapidated family home.

There's no I in TEAM!! We're all on the case, and this is how you know it :)
